NOTICE Please note there are NO walk-ins for COVID-19 testing available at Merced County Department of Public Health.
All testing MUST be scheduled through your Primary Care Physician.

div.class: inner col col24 first last idf06ce223-8483-4168-8461-b8f20f0a336f

a.aria-label: Take the CDC Self-Screening Evaluation Here Opens in new window

span.strong: Click Here to Take the CDC Self-Screening Evaluation

div.p: The Merced County Department of Public Health is closely following the guidance of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and California Department of Public Health on the novel (new) nCoV virus that is causing an outbreak of pneumonia illness. Coronavirus is a type of virus that causes diseases of varying severities, ranging from the common cold to more serious respiratory disease.

p.strong: Persons who have recently traveled to China, Japan, South Korea, Iran, or Italy, or who have had contact with a person with possible COVID-19 infection and have the above symptoms should call their local health department or health care provider immediately.

div.p: Do not go to your providerâ€™s office without calling ahead. Do not call 911 for suspected COVID-19 unless you are having a medical emergency.

a.strong: Watch an Informational Video from the Merced County Public Health Officer, Dr. Ken Bird

div.class: inner col col12 first last id47b8324e-27e8-4eee-9a81-22eabb6e9bc8

ul.li: Individuals with serious chronic medical conditions like heart disease, diabetes, or lung disease
Close personal contact, such as touching shaking hands
Touching an object or surface with the virus on it, then touching your mouth, nose, or eyes before washing your hands

div.p: Novel coronavirus is new, and we are continuing to learn about spreading Â patterns and incubation periods
There is no specific antiviral treatment recommended for the 2019-nCoV infection. People with symptoms should contact their providers.
Currently, there is no vaccine available to protect against 2019-nCoV.

div.class: inner col col12 first last idb099d943-8c85-46d8-ab2e-9bd8a3984b64

ul.li: Novel Coronavirus is a new virus that hasnâ€™t been identified before in humans.
Coronavirus can spread through close personal contact, or by touching an object of surface with the virus on it.
Use prevention measures that work to prevent other respiratory infections to prevent novel Coronavirus.
The Merced County Department of Public Health is taking steps to prevent the spread of Coronavirus in Merced County.

strong.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

div.p: East Merced County includes Atwater, Ballico, Bear Creek, Calpack, Cressey, Delhi, El Nido, Hilmar, Irwin, Le Grand, Livingston, Merced, Planada, Snelling, Stevinson, Tuttle, and Winton
West Merced County includes Dos Palos, Gustine, Los Banos, Santa Nella, and Volta
